description: From Middle English outseken, equivalent to out- +‎ seek. Cognate with Saterland Frisian uutsäike, West Frisian útsykje (“to seek out”), Dutch uitzoeken (“to pick, sort out, investigate”), German Low German utsöken, German aussuchen (“to choose, select, pick out”).

verbs.description: outseek (third-person singular simple present outseeks, present participle outseeking, simple past and past participle outsought)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To seek out; actively or diligently search for; investigate; research.
examples: […]  Who thro' mist and darkness still the truth outsought;  […]
